info.title: Loyalty
info.description:
### Loyalty

The Loyalty API enables mapping of partner loyalty and discount cards with associated ABG discounts codes and free options. The API also returns the best discount with the provided passenger(s) information when there is more than one passenger.

/partner.x-amf-description: Partner loyalty and ABG discount lookup data.

schema.title: Loyalty tier lookup information
schema.description: Partner loyalty and discount cards with associated ABG discounts codes and free options.

request_time.description: The time stamp of the request

success.title: Success details
success.description: Success response metadata for all the rest APIs.

code.description: The HTTP status code value

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.description: Transaction details that may be used by your application to identify a request.

system_id.title: Internal correlation  identifier
system_id.description: A unique identifier generated internally by the application to identify the payload and troubleshoot.

loyalty_discounts.title: Loyalty lookup
loyalty_discounts.description: General loyalty lookup information. Acts as a passenger context on request. The response includes Mapped ABG discounts and best discount.

rate_qualifiers.title: Reservation rate qualifiers
rate_qualifiers.description: The information determines/influences the rate of the reservation in the localized currency.

discount.title: Brand Discounts
discount.description: The rental vehicle brand rewards program code (also known as discount code) to be applied to the rate of the reservation.

code.title: Discount code
code.description: The rental vehicle brand discount code. This field can be an Avis Worldwide Discount (AWD), Budget Car Discount (BCD), or a Payless Discount Number (PDN) code.

loyalty.title: Loyalty
loyalty.description: Profile information of the user. The personal brand identification information of the user for the Avis, Budget, or Payless user profile.

program.title: Avis Budget Group loyalty program
program.description: The Avis Budget Group brand loyalty program name. The program can be an Avis Preferred, Avis Preferred Plus, Avis Platinum for Avis brand.

code.title: Loyalty code
code.description: The brand loyalty program code. This can be an Avis wizard number, Budget customer number, or Payless Perks number.

brand.title: Avis Budget Group brand
brand.description: The brand associated with the loyalty program.

coupon.title: Coupon
coupon.description: Coupon infomation for reservation discounts and benefits.

code.title: Coupon code
code.description: The coupon code to be applied to the reservation rate.

type.title: Coupon type
type.description: The type of coupon that corresponds to the coupon code.

description.title: Coupon description
description.description: Description of the coupon code that was specified in the request.
description.example: 25USD Off with Rental of CSS/Paperless Coupon

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of coupon codes to apply to the reservation.

coupon_applied.title: Coupon applied flag
coupon_applied.description: Indicates that a coupon code is valid and was successfully applied for the reservation.

coupon_amount.title: Coupon amount
coupon_amount.description: The amount of the coupon discount applied to the cost of the reservation.

coupon_extras.title: Coupon extras
coupon_extras.description: The ancillary products tied to the coupon. For example, if the coupon code specified in the request applies to the cost of a child safety seat, then CSS will be returned in this field.

items.title: Rental Extras
items.description: The ancillary products, special equipment, and other extras selected as part of reservation.

type.title: Extras type
type.description: The type of ancillary product specified in the request. If a code of child safety seat (CSS) is specified in the request, then a value of SPEC_EQUIP will be returned in the response.

code.title: Extras code
code.description: The rental ancillary code used to identify and add rental vehicle equipment and features to the reservation (such as GPS).

quantity.title: Extras quantity
quantity.description: The number of ancillary products to add to the reservation. For example, if a value of 2 is specified for quantity, and a code of CSS, then two child safety seats will be added to the reservation.

amount.title: Extra product amount
amount.description: The price of the ancillary product.

total_owed.title: Total amount of the extra product
total_owed.description: The total price of the ancillary product for the entirety of the reservation period.

membership.title: Frequent Traveler Programs (FTPs)
membership.description: The Frequent Traveler Program (FTP) to be applied to the reservation. This entitles the user the opportunity to earn miles or points with ABG partners, such as airlines, hotels and other select companies. For example, the Lufthansa Miles & More Rewards Program. Surcharges may apply.

code.title: Frequent Traveler Program number
code.description: The unique Frequent Traveler Program (FTP) number of the traveler.

age.title: Age
age.description: Driver’s age. This might influence the rates. Will be superseded by date of birth found in the profile provided in “membership_code”.

date_of_birth.title: Date of Birth
date_of_birth.description: Driver’s date of birth. This might influence the rates. Will be superseded by “age” parameter or date of birth found in the profile provided in “membership_code”

partner_loyalty.title: Partner Loyalty
partner_loyalty.description: The partner loyalty discount program. The partner loyalty to be applied to drive the rate of booking.

program.title: Partner Program Name
program.description: Valid partner loyalty program from the user request, as agreed by partner integration.

partner_discount.title: Partner Discount
partner_discount.description: The partner commercial discount program. The discount to be applied to drive the rate of the booking.

program.title: Commercial Discount Name
program.description: Valid partner discount name from the user request, as agreed by partner integration.

mapped_discounts.title: Mapped discounts
mapped_discounts.description: Mapped Avis Budget Group discounts along with their free options.

items.title: Commercial discount
items.description: The commercial rental vehicle brand rewards program code (also known as discount code). The discounts applied to the rate of the reservation.

brand.title: The Avis, Budget, or Payless brand name.
brand.description: ABG supported brand names like Avis, Budget, or Payless..

code.title: Discount code
code.description: The rental vehicle brand discount code. This field can be an Avis Worldwide Discount (AWD), Budget Car Discount (BCD), or a Payless Discount Number (PDN) code.

percent.title: Discount percentage
percent.description: The discount percentage applied to the reservation.

free_options.title: Free options
free_options.description: Eligible free ancillary products and benefits offered.

quantity.title: Eligible extras quantity
quantity.description: The total number of ancillary products.

items.title: Extras code
items.description: The rental ancillary code used to identify and add rental vehicle equipment and features to the reservation (such as GPS).

meet_and_greet.title: Meet and Greet
meet_and_greet.description: Indicates the free meet and greet feature for the brand.

pickup_date_range.title: Pickup date range
pickup_date_range.description: Pickup date range for the eligibility of promotional discounts.

to.title: To date
to.description: End date for the data range in ISO 8601 representation.

from.title: From date
from.description: Start date for the date range ISO 8601 representation.

dropoff_date_range.title: Dropoff date range
dropoff_date_range.description: Dropoff date range for eligibility of the promotional discounts.

to.title: To date
to.description: End date for the data range in ISO 8601 representation.

from.title: From date
from.description: Start date for the date range ISO 8601 representation.

reservation_date_range.title: Booking date range
reservation_date_range.description: Boking date range for the promotional discounts.

to.title: To date
to.description: End date for the data range in ISO 8601 representation.

from.title: From date
from.description: Start date for the date range ISO 8601 representation.

best_discount.title: Best discount
best_discount.description: Represent the best discount with the provided passenger(s) information when there is more than one passenger.

driver.title: Driver of the vehicle
driver.description: Indicator to represent the primary or secondary driver of the vehicle.

400.description: 400 Bad Request is returned when the request could not be understood by the server. 400 includes missing required values, invalid data types, minimum/maximum values, ranges and format.

schema.title: 400 Bad Request
schema.description: ABG common error object, which has error and transaction details which helps identify the root cause of the request failure.

errors.details: Specified parameter <parameter name> is not valid

request_errors.description: The number of errors that occurred

errors.title: Errors
errors.description: A detailed description of the reason for a request failure

code.title: HTTP status code
code.description: HTTP status code for the response

message.title: Response Message
message.description: Based on the type of response it displays either success or error message

reason.title: Response reason
reason.description: Currently, this field is applicable only for error scenarios, which contains the detailed error message.

details.title: Response details
details.description: Based on the kind of response this field contains either success or error details. In the case of errors, this field indicates the reason of request failure.

404.description: 404 Not Found is returned when server cannot find the matching request URI (either due to no results, or because of a non-existent endpoint or resource). Server may also respond with this status code when there is 401 or 403, which the service wants to mask for security reasons.

schema.title: 404 Not Found
schema.description: ABG common error object, which has error and transaction details which helps identify the root cause of the request failure.

errors.details: Server cannot find the requested resource. This may be due to incorrect URI or a resource that is not available.

500.description: 500 Internal Server Error is returned when a system or application error has occurred. It generally indicates that something unexpected has gone wrong on the server. This is used for a standard server side exception for a persistent error on the server side.

/partner/program.x-amf-description: Obtain the ABG discount codes for partner loyalty program and merchant discounts.

schema.title: Partner loyalty and discounts
schema.description: Commercially agreed partner loyalties and discounts to be sent in the request.

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.description: Transaction details that may be used by your application to identify a request.

system_id.title: Internal correlation  identifier
system_id.description: A unique identifier generated internally by the application to identify the payload and troubleshoot.

name.title: Partner name
name.description: The organization or entity name registered and obtained through partner onboarding process.

iata_number.title: Partner IATA number
iata_number.description: International Air Transport Association (IATA) number. This is an identifier used by travel agents that allows the rental car company to pay the agent a commission for the rental.

loyalty_discounts.title: Loyalty lookup
loyalty_discounts.description: General loyalty lookup information. Acts as a passenger context on request. The response includes Mapped ABG discounts and best discount.

quantity.description: The total number of ancillary products.

items.title: Extras code
items.description: The rental ancillary code used to identify and add rental vehicle equipment and features to the reservation (such as GPS).

meet_and_greet.title: Meet and Greet
meet_and_greet.description: Indicates the free meet and greet feature for the brand.

pickup_date_range.title: Pickup date range
pickup_date_range.description: Pickup date range for the eligibility of promotional discounts.

to.title: To date
to.description: End date for the data range in ISO 8601 representation.

from.title: From date
from.description: Start date for the date range ISO 8601 representation.

dropoff_date_range.title: Dropoff date range
dropoff_date_range.description: Dropoff date range for eligibility of the promotional discounts.

to.title: To date
to.description: End date for the data range in ISO 8601 representation.

from.title: From date
from.description: Start date for the date range ISO 8601 representation.

reservation_date_range.title: Booking date range
reservation_date_range.description: Boking date range for the promotional discounts.

to.title: To date
to.description: End date for the data range in ISO 8601 representation.

from.title: From date
from.description: Start date for the date range ISO 8601 representation.

best_discount.title: Best discount
best_discount.description: Represent the best discount with the provided passenger(s) information when there is more than one passenger.

driver.title: Driver of the vehicle
driver.description: Indicator to represent the primary or secondary driver of the vehicle.

400.description: 400 Bad Request is returned when the request could not be understood by the server. 400 includes missing required values, invalid data types, minimum/maximum values, ranges and format.

schema.title: 400 Bad Request
schema.description: ABG common error object, which has error and transaction details which helps identify the root cause of the request failure.

errors.details: Specified parameter <parameter name> is not valid

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.description: Transaction details that may be used by your application to identify a request.

system_id.title: Internal correlation  identifier
system_id.description: A unique identifier generated internally by the application to identify the payload and troubleshoot.

request_time.title: Request time
request_time.description: The time stamp of the request

request_errors.title: Request errors
request_errors.description: The number of errors that occurred

errors.title: Errors
errors.description: A detailed description of the reason for a request failure

code.title: HTTP status code
code.description: HTTP status code for the response

message.title: Response Message
message.description: Based on the type of response it displays either success or error message

reason.title: Response reason
reason.description: Currently, this field is applicable only for error scenarios, which contains the detailed error message.

details.title: Response details
details.description: Based on the kind of response this field contains either success or error details. In the case of errors, this field indicates the reason of request failure.

404.description: 404 Not Found is returned when server cannot find the matching request URI (either due to no results, or because of a non-existent endpoint or resource). Server may also respond with this status code when there is 401 or 403, which the service wants to mask for security reasons.

schema.title: 404 Not Found
schema.description: ABG common error object, which has error and transaction details which helps identify the root cause of the request failure.

errors.details: Server cannot find the requested resource. This may be due to incorrect URI or a resource that is not available.

405.description: A request method is not supported for the requested resource; for example, a GET request on a form that requires data to be presented via POST, or a PUT request on a read-only resource.

415.description: The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support. For example, the client uploads an image as image/svg+xml, but the server requires that images use a different format.

500.description: 500 Internal Server Error is returned when a system or application error has occurred. It generally indicates that something unexpected has gone wrong on the server. This is used for a standard server side exception for a persistent error on the server side.

schema.title: 500 Internal Server Error
schema.description: ABG common error object, which has error and transaction details which helps identify the root cause of the request failure.
